missing_semicolon.title: Missing Semicolon
missing_semicolon.explanation: Every Java statement must end with a semicolon. The compiler throws this when it encounters a missing one.

unmatched_parentheses.title: Unmatched Parentheses
unmatched_parentheses.explanation: A closing parenthesis is missing or misplaced.

unmatched_curly_braces.pattern: reached end of file while parsing
unmatched_curly_braces.title: Unmatched Curly Braces
unmatched_curly_braces.explanation: A closing curly brace '}' is missing for a class, method, or block.

unmatched_square_brackets.title: Unmatched Square Brackets
unmatched_square_brackets.explanation: A closing square bracket ']' is missing in array or index syntax.

invalid_identifier.title: Invalid Identifier
invalid_identifier.explanation: An identifier is invalid or used incorrectly, causing a syntax issue.
invalid_identifier.fix_example: Avoid using keywords or illegal characters as identifiers.

keyword_misuse.title: Keyword Misuse
keyword_misuse.explanation: A keyword is used where an expression or identifier is expected.
keyword_misuse.fix_example: Check if-else, for, class, and other keywords are used in proper contexts.

illegal_start_of_expression.title: Illegal Start of Expression
illegal_start_of_expression.explanation: Occurs when a statement is misplaced or a keyword is used incorrectly.
illegal_start_of_expression.fix_example: Ensure statements are within methods or blocks and follow Java syntax.

illegal_start_of_type.title: Illegal Start of Type
illegal_start_of_type.explanation: Class or interface definitions contain invalid modifiers or misplaced elements.
illegal_start_of_type.fix_example: Check class-level declarations and remove misplaced tokens.

expected_token.title: Expected Token Error
expected_token.explanation: The compiler expected a specific symbol (like ')', '}', ';') but did not find it.
expected_token.fix_example: Read the error message to see which symbol is expected and insert it.

reached_end_of_file_while_parsing.pattern: reached end of file while parsing
reached_end_of_file_while_parsing.title: Reached End of File While Parsing
reached_end_of_file_while_parsing.explanation: The compiler hit the end of the file before completing parsing.
reached_end_of_file_while_parsing.fix_example: Check for missing closing braces, parentheses, or unfinished statements.

class_interface_enum_expected.title: Class, Interface, or Enum Expected
class_interface_enum_expected.explanation: Top-level code must be a class, interface, or enum declaration.
class_interface_enum_expected.fix_example: Move executable statements inside a class or method.

variable_declaration_syntax_error.title: Variable Declaration Syntax Error
variable_declaration_syntax_error.explanation: Variable declarations are malformed or placed incorrectly.
variable_declaration_syntax_error.fix_example: Use: type name = value; inside a method or class.

invalid_method_signature.pattern: invalid method declaration; return type required
invalid_method_signature.title: Invalid Method Signature
invalid_method_signature.explanation: Method declaration is missing a valid return type or name.
invalid_method_signature.fix_example: Specify a return type and a legal method name.

incorrect_access_modifier_usage.title: Incorrect Access Modifier Usage
incorrect_access_modifier_usage.explanation: An access modifier is used in a context where it is not allowed.
incorrect_access_modifier_usage.fix_example: Use access modifiers only in class, method, or field declarations.

duplicate_modifier.title: Duplicate Modifier
duplicate_modifier.explanation: A modifier such as public, static, or final is repeated unnecessarily.
duplicate_modifier.fix_example: Remove duplicate modifiers, e.g., 'public public class Test' is invalid.

invalid_modifier.title: Invalid Modifier
invalid_modifier.explanation: A modifier is being used where it is not permitted.
invalid_modifier.fix_example: Check Java rules for where modifiers like static, abstract, final are allowed.

static_context_syntax_error.pattern: non-static .* cannot be referenced from a static context
static_context_syntax_error.title: Static Context Syntax Error
static_context_syntax_error.explanation: Instance members are used directly inside a static context.
static_context_syntax_error.fix_example: Create an instance or make members static if appropriate.

return_type_missing.pattern: invalid method declaration; return type required
return_type_missing.title: Return Type Missing
return_type_missing.explanation: A return type is missing in method declaration.
return_type_missing.fix_example: Add a return type, e.g., void or an appropriate type.

invalid_return_statement_syntax.title: Invalid Return Statement
invalid_return_statement_syntax.explanation: A return statement appears outside a method or constructor.
invalid_return_statement_syntax.fix_example: Ensure return is only inside methods or constructors.

constructor_syntax_error.pattern: invalid method declaration; return type required
constructor_syntax_error.title: Constructor Syntax Error
constructor_syntax_error.explanation: Constructor is incorrectly declared with a return type or wrong name.
constructor_syntax_error.fix_example: Constructor must have same name as class and no return type.

package_declaration_syntax_error.title: Package Declaration Syntax Error
package_declaration_syntax_error.explanation: The package declaration may be malformed or not at the top of the file.
package_declaration_syntax_error.fix_example: Use: package com.example; as the first non-comment line.

import_statement_syntax_error.title: Import Statement Syntax Error
import_statement_syntax_error.explanation: The import statement refers to a non-existing or incorrect package/class.
import_statement_syntax_error.fix_example: Verify package and class names in import statements.

invalid_statement_placement.title: Invalid Statement Placement
invalid_statement_placement.explanation: Statements are placed where only declarations are allowed.
invalid_statement_placement.fix_example: Move executable code into methods or blocks.

unterminated_string_literal.title: Unterminated String Literal
unterminated_string_literal.explanation: A string literal is missing the closing quote.
unterminated_string_literal.fix_example: Ensure all string literals start and end with double quotes.

invalid_escape_sequence.title: Invalid Escape Sequence
invalid_escape_sequence.explanation: An invalid escape sequence is used in a string or char literal.

invalid_character_literal.title: Invalid Character Literal
invalid_character_literal.explanation: A character literal is not properly formed.
invalid_character_literal.fix_example: Use single quotes around a single character, e.g., 'a'.

numeric_literal_format_error.pattern: integer number too large|malformed floating point literal
numeric_literal_format_error.title: Numeric Literal Format Error
numeric_literal_format_error.explanation: A numeric literal is out of range or incorrectly formatted.
numeric_literal_format_error.fix_example: Check for correct use of digits, underscores, and suffixes like L or F.

array_declaration_syntax_error.title: Array Declaration Syntax Error
array_declaration_syntax_error.explanation: Array syntax is incorrect or placed improperly.

generic_syntax_error.pattern: illegal start of type|cannot infer type arguments for
generic_syntax_error.title: Generic Syntax Error
generic_syntax_error.explanation: Generic type parameters are misused or incorrectly declared.
generic_syntax_error.fix_example: Check generic type usage like List<String> and ensure proper syntax.

annotation_syntax_error.pattern: annotation type not applicable to this kind of declaration
annotation_syntax_error.title: Annotation Syntax Error
annotation_syntax_error.explanation: An annotation is used in an unsupported context.
annotation_syntax_error.fix_example: Use annotations only on supported elements (class, method, field, etc.).

switch_statement_syntax_error.title: Switch Statement Syntax Error
switch_statement_syntax_error.explanation: A case or default label appears outside a switch statement.
switch_statement_syntax_error.fix_example: Place case/default labels only inside a valid switch block.

try_catch_syntax_error.title: Try–Catch Syntax Error
try_catch_syntax_error.explanation: A catch block appears without a corresponding try block.
try_catch_syntax_error.fix_example: Ensure every catch follows a try block.

catch_block_ordering_error.title: Catch Block Ordering Error
catch_block_ordering_error.explanation: A more specific exception is caught after a more general one.
catch_block_ordering_error.fix_example: Place specific exception catch blocks before general ones.

finally_block_syntax_error.title: Finally Block Syntax Error
finally_block_syntax_error.explanation: A finally block appears without a try block.
finally_block_syntax_error.fix_example: Use finally only after a valid try (and optional catch).

if_else_syntax_error.title: If–Else Syntax Error
if_else_syntax_error.explanation: An else statement does not have a matching if.
if_else_syntax_error.fix_example: Ensure every else has a corresponding if with proper braces.

loop_syntax_error.title: Loop Syntax Error
loop_syntax_error.explanation: Loop syntax for for/while/do-while is incorrect.
loop_syntax_error.fix_example: Check parentheses, semicolons, and block braces in loop statements.

lambda_syntax_error.pattern: lambda expressions are not supported in -source
lambda_syntax_error.title: Lambda Expression Syntax/Error
lambda_syntax_error.explanation: Lambda expression used with an unsupported source level or incorrect syntax.
lambda_syntax_error.fix_example: Use correct lambda syntax and Java 8+ compilation options.

enum_declaration_syntax_error.title: Enum Declaration Syntax Error
enum_declaration_syntax_error.explanation: Enum constants or body are incorrectly defined.
enum_declaration_syntax_error.fix_example: Separate enum constants with commas and define them before methods.

interface_method_syntax_error.title: Interface Method Syntax Error
interface_method_syntax_error.explanation: Interface methods in older Java versions must be abstract-like declarations without bodies.
interface_method_syntax_error.fix_example: Use method signatures without bodies, or use default/static methods properly in newer Java.

abstract_method_syntax_error.pattern: missing method body, or declare abstract
abstract_method_syntax_error.title: Abstract Method Syntax Error
abstract_method_syntax_error.explanation: An abstract method lacks a body or is not marked abstract.
abstract_method_syntax_error.fix_example: Either provide a body or declare the method abstract in an abstract class.

type_mismatch.title: Type Mismatch
type_mismatch.explanation: The assigned value type does not match the variable type.
type_mismatch.fix_example: Ensure both sides of the assignment use compatible types or cast safely.

incompatible_data_type_assignment.title: Incompatible Data Type Assignment
incompatible_data_type_assignment.explanation: A value is assigned to a variable of an incompatible type.
incompatible_data_type_assignment.fix_example: Use proper type conversion or correct the variable type.

possible_lossy_conversion.title: Possible Lossy Conversion
possible_lossy_conversion.explanation: A narrowing primitive conversion may result in data loss.
possible_lossy_conversion.fix_example: Use an explicit cast only if safe, or use a wider type.

incompatible_return_type.pattern: incompatible types: .* cannot be converted to
incompatible_return_type.title: Incompatible Return Type
incompatible_return_type.explanation: Method return type doesn't match the declared type.
incompatible_return_type.fix_example: Change return type or return value to make them compatible.

cannot_find_symbol.title: Cannot Find Symbol
cannot_find_symbol.explanation: A variable, method, or class is referenced but not defined or imported.

variable_not_initialized.pattern: variable .* might not have been initialized
variable_not_initialized.title: Variable Not Initialized
variable_not_initialized.explanation: A local variable is used before being given a value.
variable_not_initialized.fix_example: Assign a value to the variable before first use.

unreachable_statement.title: Unreachable Statement
unreachable_statement.explanation: The compiler detects code that can never execute.
unreachable_statement.fix_example: Remove or refactor code so that all statements are reachable.

missing_return_statement.title: Missing Return Statement
missing_return_statement.explanation: A method with non-void return type does not always return a value.
missing_return_statement.fix_example: Return a value on all code paths in the method.

incompatible_operand_types.pattern: bad operand types for binary operator
incompatible_operand_types.title: Incompatible Operand Types
incompatible_operand_types.explanation: An operator is applied to operands of incompatible types.
incompatible_operand_types.fix_example: Ensure correct operand types or cast appropriately.

operator_cannot_be_applied.title: Operator Cannot Be Applied
operator_cannot_be_applied.explanation: An operator is used with unsupported operand types.
operator_cannot_be_applied.fix_example: Check operator and operand types for compatibility.

array_index_type_mismatch.title: Array Index Type Mismatch
array_index_type_mismatch.explanation: Array indexing used on a non-array type or with wrong syntax.
array_index_type_mismatch.fix_example: Ensure the variable is an array and index is an int.

invalid_cast.title: Invalid Cast
invalid_cast.explanation: A cast between incompatible reference types was attempted.
invalid_cast.fix_example: Use instanceof before casting and ensure the cast is legal.

compile_time_class_not_found.title: Class Not Found (Compile Time)
compile_time_class_not_found.explanation: The referenced class is not found by the compiler.
compile_time_class_not_found.fix_example: Add the correct import or ensure the class is in the classpath.

package_does_not_exist.title: Package Does Not Exist
package_does_not_exist.explanation: The imported package cannot be found.
package_does_not_exist.fix_example: Check package spelling and add required libraries.

duplicate_class.title: Duplicate Class
duplicate_class.explanation: Two classes with the same fully qualified name exist.
duplicate_class.fix_example: Remove or rename duplicate class files.

duplicate_method_signature.pattern: method .* is already defined in class
duplicate_method_signature.title: Duplicate Method Signature
duplicate_method_signature.explanation: A method with the same signature exists already in the class.
duplicate_method_signature.fix_example: Rename the method or change its parameters.

duplicate_variable.title: Duplicate Variable
duplicate_variable.explanation: A variable with the same name already exists in the scope.
duplicate_variable.fix_example: Rename the variable or remove the duplicate declaration.

method_not_found.title: Method Not Found
method_not_found.explanation: The method is not declared or visible in the class.
method_not_found.fix_example: Check method name, parameters, and class imports.

method_argument_mismatch.title: Method Argument Mismatch
method_argument_mismatch.explanation: No method matches the provided argument types.
method_argument_mismatch.fix_example: Ensure arguments match the declared parameter types.

ambiguous_method_call.title: Ambiguous Method Call
ambiguous_method_call.explanation: The compiler cannot decide between multiple overloaded methods.
ambiguous_method_call.fix_example: Cast arguments explicitly or change method names.

overriding_signature_mismatch.pattern: method does not override or implement a method from a supertype
overriding_signature_mismatch.title: Overriding Method Signature Mismatch
overriding_signature_mismatch.explanation: A method is marked @Override but does not match any superclass/interface method.
overriding_signature_mismatch.fix_example: Adjust method signature to match the method being overridden.

override_weaker_access.pattern: attempting to assign weaker access privileges
override_weaker_access.title: Overriding with Weaker Access Privilege
override_weaker_access.explanation: An overriding method cannot have more restrictive access than the overridden method.
override_weaker_access.fix_example: Use same or less restrictive access (e.g., public instead of private).

override_final_method.title: Overriding Final Method
override_final_method.fix_example: Remove override attempt or do not declare the superclass method as final.

override_static_method.title: Overriding Static Method
override_static_method.explanation: Static methods are hidden, not overridden.

cannot_override_return_type.title: Cannot Override Return Type
cannot_override_return_type.explanation: Overriding method returns a type incompatible with the superclass method.
cannot_override_return_type.fix_example: Use a covariant return type or match the superclass return type.

abstract_method_not_implemented.pattern: is not abstract and does not override abstract method
abstract_method_not_implemented.title: Abstract Method Not Implemented
abstract_method_not_implemented.explanation: A concrete class does not implement all abstract methods.
abstract_method_not_implemented.fix_example: Implement all abstract methods or make the class abstract.

instantiation_of_abstract_class.title: Instantiation of Abstract Class
instantiation_of_abstract_class.explanation: Abstract classes cannot be instantiated directly.

instantiation_of_interface.title: Instantiation of Interface
instantiation_of_interface.fix_example: Use a class implementing the interface or an anonymous implementation.

final_variable_reassignment.pattern: cannot assign a value to final variable
final_variable_reassignment.title: Final Variable Reassignment
final_variable_reassignment.explanation: A final variable is being assigned a new value.
final_variable_reassignment.fix_example: Remove the reassignment or do not declare the variable final.

final_method_override_attempt.title: Final Method Override Attempt
final_method_override_attempt.explanation: Attempt to override a method that is declared final.
final_method_override_attempt.fix_example: Do not override the method or remove final from the parent method.

final_class_inheritance.title: Final Class Inheritance Error
final_class_inheritance.explanation: A final class cannot be extended.
final_class_inheritance.fix_example: Do not extend final classes; use composition instead.

static_reference_to_nonstatic.pattern: non-static .* cannot be referenced from a static context
static_reference_to_nonstatic.title: Static Reference to Non-Static Member
static_reference_to_nonstatic.explanation: Static methods cannot directly access instance members.
static_reference_to_nonstatic.fix_example: Create an instance or make members static if appropriate.

invalid_throws_clause.pattern: exception .* is never thrown in body of corresponding try statement
invalid_throws_clause.title: Invalid Throws or Catch Clause
invalid_throws_clause.explanation: A catch or throws clause references an exception that cannot be thrown.
invalid_throws_clause.fix_example: Remove the unused exception or adjust the code to actually throw it.

unhandled_checked_exception.pattern: unreported exception .*; must be caught or declared to be thrown
unhandled_checked_exception.title: Unhandled Checked Exception
unhandled_checked_exception.explanation: A checked exception is not handled or declared.
unhandled_checked_exception.fix_example: Wrap it in try-catch or add it to the method's throws clause.

cyclic_inheritance.title: Cyclic Inheritance Error
cyclic_inheritance.explanation: Class hierarchies must not form cycles.

invalid_super_constructor_call.pattern: constructor .* in class .* cannot be applied to given types
invalid_super_constructor_call.title: Invalid Superclass Constructor Call
invalid_super_constructor_call.explanation: The super() call does not match any superclass constructor.
invalid_super_constructor_call.fix_example: Adjust super() arguments or change superclass constructors.

no_default_constructor.title: No Default Constructor Available
no_default_constructor.explanation: A class without a no-arg constructor is being instantiated with no arguments.
no_default_constructor.fix_example: Add a default constructor or call an existing one with parameters.

accessing_private_member.title: Accessing Private Member
accessing_private_member.explanation: Code is trying to access a private member from outside its class.
accessing_private_member.fix_example: Use getters/setters or adjust access modifier.

protected_access_violation.title: Protected Access Violation
protected_access_violation.explanation: Protected member accessed from a non-subclass in a different package.
protected_access_violation.fix_example: Access via subclass or adjust access modifiers.

package_private_access_violation.pattern: is not public in .*; cannot be accessed from outside package
package_private_access_violation.title: Package-Private Access Violation
package_private_access_violation.explanation: A class with default (package-private) access is used from another package.
package_private_access_violation.fix_example: Make the class public or move code into the same package.

generic_type_bounds_violation.title: Generic Type Bounds Violation
generic_type_bounds_violation.explanation: Type argument does not satisfy the generic bounds.
generic_type_bounds_violation.fix_example: Use a type parameter that meets all declared bounds.

raw_type_usage.title: Raw Type Usage
raw_type_usage.explanation: A generic type is used without specifying type parameters.
raw_type_usage.fix_example: Use parameterized types like List<String> instead of raw List.

type_erasure_conflict.pattern: name clash: .* have the same erasure
type_erasure_conflict.title: Type Erasure Conflict
type_erasure_conflict.explanation: Overloaded methods conflict after generic type erasure.
type_erasure_conflict.fix_example: Use distinct method names or change parameter lists.

incompatible_generic_assignment.pattern: incompatible types: .* cannot be converted to
incompatible_generic_assignment.title: Incompatible Generic Assignment
incompatible_generic_assignment.explanation: Assignment between generic types that are not compatible.
incompatible_generic_assignment.fix_example: Use compatible generic types or wildcards.

annotation_type_mismatch.pattern: incompatible types: .* cannot be converted to
annotation_type_mismatch.title: Annotation Type Mismatch
annotation_type_mismatch.explanation: Annotation value type does not match the element type.
annotation_type_mismatch.fix_example: Provide a value matching the expected type.

invalid_annotation_target.pattern: annotation type not applicable to this kind of declaration
invalid_annotation_target.title: Invalid Annotation Target
invalid_annotation_target.explanation: Annotation applied to an unsupported program element.
invalid_annotation_target.fix_example: Use annotation only on supported targets.

invalid_functional_interface.title: Invalid Functional Interface
invalid_functional_interface.explanation: Functional interface must have exactly one abstract method.
invalid_functional_interface.fix_example: Ensure only one abstract method or use a non-functional interface.

lambda_parameter_type_mismatch.pattern: incompatible parameter types in lambda expression
lambda_parameter_type_mismatch.title: Lambda Parameter Type Mismatch
lambda_parameter_type_mismatch.explanation: Lambda parameter types do not match the target functional interface.
lambda_parameter_type_mismatch.fix_example: Ensure lambda parameters match the abstract method's parameters.

ArithmeticException.title: ArithmeticException
ArithmeticException.explanation: An invalid arithmetic operation occurred, often division by zero.
ArithmeticException.fix_example: Check operands before division or modulo operations.

NullPointerException.title: NullPointerException
NullPointerException.explanation: Code attempted to dereference a null reference.
NullPointerException.fix_example: Add null checks or ensure objects are properly initialized.

ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException.title: ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException.explanation: An array index is outside the valid range.
ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException.fix_example: Ensure index is between 0 and array.length - 1.

StringIndexOutOfBoundsException.title: StringIndexOutOfBoundsException
StringIndexOutOfBoundsException.explanation: A string index is outside the valid range.
StringIndexOutOfBoundsException.fix_example: Check string length before using charAt or substring.

IndexOutOfBoundsException.title: IndexOutOfBoundsException
IndexOutOfBoundsException.explanation: An index in a list or collection is out of range.
IndexOutOfBoundsException.fix_example: Check index against collection size before access.

NumberFormatException.title: NumberFormatException
NumberFormatException.explanation: A string that is not a valid number was parsed as a number.
NumberFormatException.fix_example: Validate or sanitize input before parsing.

ClassCastException.title: ClassCastException
ClassCastException.explanation: An object was cast to an incompatible type.
ClassCastException.fix_example: Use instanceof before casting and ensure correct type usage.

IllegalArgumentException.title: IllegalArgumentException
IllegalArgumentException.explanation: A method received an argument that is illegal or inappropriate.
IllegalArgumentException.fix_example: Validate method arguments and check bounds or nullability.

IllegalStateException.title: IllegalStateException
IllegalStateException.explanation: A method has been invoked at an illegal or inappropriate time.
IllegalStateException.fix_example: Check object state and method preconditions before invocation.

NegativeArraySizeException.title: NegativeArraySizeException
NegativeArraySizeException.explanation: An attempt was made to create an array with negative size.
NegativeArraySizeException.fix_example: Verify that array sizes are non-negative.

ArrayStoreException.title: ArrayStoreException
ArrayStoreException.explanation: An array element of an incompatible type was stored.
ArrayStoreException.fix_example: Ensure that only compatible types are stored in the array.

ConcurrentModificationException.title: ConcurrentModificationException
ConcurrentModificationException.explanation: A collection was modified while iterating over it.

UnsupportedOperationException.title: UnsupportedOperationException
UnsupportedOperationException.explanation: An unsupported operation was attempted, often on an unmodifiable collection.
UnsupportedOperationException.fix_example: Check if the collection is modifiable before attempting modifications.

NoSuchElementException.title: NoSuchElementException
NoSuchElementException.explanation: An attempt was made to access an element that does not exist.

InputMismatchException.title: InputMismatchException
InputMismatchException.explanation: Scanner input type does not match the expected type.
InputMismatchException.fix_example: Validate input or use nextLine and parse manually.

SecurityException.title: SecurityException
SecurityException.explanation: A security violation is detected by the security manager.
SecurityException.fix_example: Check security policy restrictions and requested operation.

UnsupportedClassVersionError.title: UnsupportedClassVersionError
UnsupportedClassVersionError.explanation: Class was compiled with a higher Java version than the runtime.
UnsupportedClassVersionError.fix_example: Recompile with a compatible target version or update the JVM.

StackOverflowError.title: StackOverflowError
StackOverflowError.explanation: Excessive recursion or deep call stack exhausted the stack memory.
StackOverflowError.fix_example: Fix recursion or reduce call depth.

OutOfMemoryError.title: OutOfMemoryError
OutOfMemoryError.fix_example: Optimize memory usage or increase heap size.

AssertionError.title: AssertionError
AssertionError.explanation: An assert statement failed at runtime.
AssertionError.fix_example: Verify assertion conditions or disable assertions in production.

ExceptionInInitializerError.title: ExceptionInInitializerError
ExceptionInInitializerError.explanation: An exception occurred during class initialization (static block).
ExceptionInInitializerError.fix_example: Check static initializers and handle exceptions properly.

NoClassDefFoundError.title: NoClassDefFoundError
NoClassDefFoundError.explanation: The JVM could not find a class definition at runtime that was present at compile time.
NoClassDefFoundError.fix_example: Ensure the required class is in the runtime classpath.

AbstractMethodError.title: AbstractMethodError
AbstractMethodError.explanation: An application tries to call an abstract method that has not been implemented.
AbstractMethodError.fix_example: Ensure that all abstract methods are implemented in subclasses.

UnsatisfiedLinkError.title: UnsatisfiedLinkError
UnsatisfiedLinkError.explanation: A native method could not be found.
UnsatisfiedLinkError.fix_example: Verify that native libraries are loaded and in the correct path.

VerifyError.title: VerifyError
VerifyError.fix_example: Ensure classes are compiled correctly and not modified improperly.

IncompatibleClassChangeError.title: IncompatibleClassChangeError
IncompatibleClassChangeError.explanation: A class has changed incompatibly since being compiled.
IncompatibleClassChangeError.fix_example: Recompile dependent classes and keep versions consistent.

InstantiationError.title: InstantiationError
InstantiationError.explanation: An abstract class or interface was incorrectly instantiated at runtime.

LinkageError.title: LinkageError
LinkageError.explanation: A serious problem with class loading or linking has occurred.
LinkageError.fix_example: Check for conflicting classes/JARs and version mismatches.

ThreadDeath.title: ThreadDeath
ThreadDeath.explanation: The stop method was called on a thread, causing it to terminate.
ThreadDeath.fix_example: Avoid using Thread.stop(); use interruption and flags instead.

IllegalMonitorStateException.title: IllegalMonitorStateException
IllegalMonitorStateException.explanation: wait/notify was called on an object without owning its monitor.
IllegalMonitorStateException.fix_example: Call wait/notify inside synchronized blocks on the same object.

InterruptedException.title: InterruptedException
InterruptedException.fix_example: Handle interrupts properly and restore thread interrupt status if needed.

ExecutionException.title: ExecutionException
ExecutionException.explanation: An exception was thrown during the execution of a task in a Future.
ExecutionException.fix_example: Check the cause of the ExecutionException and handle it accordingly.

TimeoutException.title: TimeoutException
TimeoutException.fix_example: Increase timeout or ensure operations complete in time.

EOFException.title: EOFException
EOFException.explanation: Unexpected end of file or stream encountered.
EOFException.fix_example: Ensure correct protocol and complete data transmission.

FileNotFoundException.title: FileNotFoundException
FileNotFoundException.explanation: A file with the specified path does not exist.
FileNotFoundException.fix_example: Check file path and ensure the file exists.

IOException.title: IOException
IOException.fix_example: Handle I/O exceptions with try-catch and provide fallbacks.

SocketException.title: SocketException
SocketException.fix_example: Check network connectivity and socket configuration.

BindException.title: BindException
BindException.explanation: A port is already in use or cannot be bound.
BindException.fix_example: Use a different port or close the process using the port.

ConnectException.title: ConnectException
ConnectException.fix_example: Check server availability and network configuration.

UnknownHostException.title: UnknownHostException
UnknownHostException.explanation: The IP address of a host could not be determined.
UnknownHostException.fix_example: Verify host name and DNS configuration.

MalformedURLException.title: MalformedURLException
MalformedURLException.fix_example: Check URL syntax, protocol, and special characters.

SSLException.title: SSLException
SSLException.fix_example: Check certificates, protocols, and SSL configuration.

ClassNotFoundException.title: ClassNotFoundException
ClassNotFoundException.explanation: A class could not be located at runtime.
ClassNotFoundException.fix_example: Ensure the class is present in the classpath.

ReflectiveOperationException.title: ReflectiveOperationException
ReflectiveOperationException.explanation: An error occurred during reflection operations.
ReflectiveOperationException.fix_example: Verify that fields/methods exist and are accessible.

InvocationTargetException.title: InvocationTargetException
InvocationTargetException.explanation: An exception was thrown by an invoked method via reflection.
InvocationTargetException.fix_example: Inspect the underlying cause (getCause()) and fix it.

MissingResourceException.title: MissingResourceException
MissingResourceException.explanation: A resource required by ResourceBundle could not be found.
MissingResourceException.fix_example: Ensure resource bundles and property files are present and correctly named.

off_by_one_error.title: Off-by-One Error
off_by_one_error.explanation: Loop bounds or index calculations are off by one.
off_by_one_error.fix_example: Check whether loops should use < or <= and index ranges carefully.

infinite_loop_mistake.title: Infinite Loop Mistake
infinite_loop_mistake.explanation: Loop condition never becomes false, causing an infinite loop.
infinite_loop_mistake.fix_example: Ensure the loop variable is updated and that exit conditions are reachable.

incorrect_loop_condition.title: Incorrect Loop Condition
incorrect_loop_condition.explanation: Loop condition logic does not match intended behavior.
incorrect_loop_condition.fix_example: Review condition and test with edge cases.

wrong_operator_usage.title: Wrong Operator Usage
wrong_operator_usage.explanation: Incorrect logical or arithmetic operator is used.

using_double_equals_instead_of_equals.title: Using == Instead of .equals()
using_double_equals_instead_of_equals.explanation: == compares references for objects instead of their contents.
using_double_equals_instead_of_equals.fix_example: Use .equals() for content comparison of strings and objects.

integer_division_mistake.title: Integer Division Mistake
integer_division_mistake.explanation: Integer division truncates decimal part unexpectedly.
integer_division_mistake.fix_example: Use double types or cast operands to double when fractional results are needed.

floating_point_precision_mistake.title: Floating-Point Precision Mistake
floating_point_precision_mistake.explanation: Floating-point arithmetic can result in precision loss.
floating_point_precision_mistake.fix_example: Use BigDecimal for precise decimal calculations like money.

ignoring_operator_precedence.title: Ignoring Operator Precedence
ignoring_operator_precedence.explanation: Expressions may be evaluated in an unintended order.
ignoring_operator_precedence.fix_example: Use parentheses to make evaluation order explicit.

incorrect_variable_scope_usage.title: Incorrect Variable Scope Usage
incorrect_variable_scope_usage.explanation: Variables are declared in the wrong scope, causing visibility issues.
incorrect_variable_scope_usage.fix_example: Declare variables in the narrowest necessary scope.

shadowing_variables_unintentionally.title: Unintentional Variable Shadowing
shadowing_variables_unintentionally.fix_example: Use different names or refer to this.field when needed.

using_uninitialized_logic_values.title: Using Uninitialized Logic Values
using_uninitialized_logic_values.explanation: Logical decisions are based on default or uninitialized values.
using_uninitialized_logic_values.fix_example: Initialize variables clearly before use in conditions.

hard_coded_values_magic_numbers.title: Hard-Coded Values (Magic Numbers)
hard_coded_values_magic_numbers.explanation: Magic numbers reduce readability and maintainability.
hard_coded_values_magic_numbers.fix_example: Replace with named constants or configuration values.

not_handling_null_cases.title: Not Handling Null Cases
not_handling_null_cases.explanation: Ignoring potential nulls can lead to NullPointerExceptions.
not_handling_null_cases.fix_example: Add null checks or use Optional to represent optional values.

ignoring_exception_handling.title: Ignoring Exception Handling
ignoring_exception_handling.explanation: Exceptions are not handled or considered.
ignoring_exception_handling.fix_example: Use try-catch or throws declarations thoughtfully.

catching_generic_exception.title: Catching Generic Exception
catching_generic_exception.explanation: Catching Exception makes it hard to distinguish specific failure causes.
catching_generic_exception.fix_example: Catch more specific exceptions to handle different cases appropriately.

swallowing_exceptions_silently.title: Swallowing Exceptions Silently
swallowing_exceptions_silently.explanation: Empty catch blocks hide problems and make debugging difficult.
swallowing_exceptions_silently.fix_example: Log exceptions or rethrow them with meaningful messages.

resource_leak_not_closing.title: Resource Leak (Not Closing Resources)
resource_leak_not_closing.explanation: Failing to close streams, readers, or connections can exhaust resources.
resource_leak_not_closing.fix_example: Use try-with-resources or finally blocks to close resources.

memory_leak_via_references.title: Memory Leak via Object References
memory_leak_via_references.fix_example: Set references to null or reduce object lifetimes appropriately.

inefficient_data_structure_choice.title: Inefficient Data Structure Choice
inefficient_data_structure_choice.fix_example: Choose data structures based on access, search, and update patterns.

wrong_algorithm_selection.title: Wrong Algorithm Selection
wrong_algorithm_selection.explanation: An inefficient algorithm chosen for a large input size.
wrong_algorithm_selection.fix_example: Analyze complexity and use more optimal algorithms.

premature_optimization_mistake.title: Premature Optimization
premature_optimization_mistake.explanation: Optimizing too early can complicate code without real benefit.
premature_optimization_mistake.fix_example: Optimize only after profiling and identifying real bottlenecks.

overcomplicated_logic.title: Overcomplicated Logic
overcomplicated_logic.explanation: Very complex logic is hard to understand and maintain.

code_duplication.title: Code Duplication
code_duplication.fix_example: Extract common logic into reusable methods.

poor_method_naming.title: Poor Method Naming
poor_method_naming.explanation: Method names do not reflect their behavior clearly.
poor_method_naming.fix_example: Choose descriptive names that indicate the method's purpose.

poor_class_design.title: Poor Class Design
poor_class_design.explanation: Classes do not have clear responsibilities or structure.
poor_class_design.fix_example: Apply object-oriented design principles and refactor responsibilities.

violating_single_responsibility.title: Violating Single Responsibility Principle
violating_single_responsibility.explanation: A class or method does too many unrelated things.
violating_single_responsibility.fix_example: Split responsibilities into separate classes or methods.

tight_coupling_between_classes.title: Tight Coupling Between Classes
tight_coupling_between_classes.explanation: Classes depend heavily on each other's implementations.

excessive_use_of_static.title: Excessive Use of Static
excessive_use_of_static.explanation: Too many static methods/fields can lead to poor design.
excessive_use_of_static.fix_example: Prefer instance methods and proper object design.

misusing_inheritance_instead_of_composit.title: Misusing Inheritance Instead of Composition
misusing_inheritance_instead_of_composit.explanation: Inheritance is used where composition would be more appropriate.
misusing_inheritance_instead_of_composit.fix_example: Use composition to reuse functionality rather than deep inheritance hierarchies.

incorrect_method_overriding_logic.title: Incorrect Method Overriding Logic
incorrect_method_overriding_logic.explanation: Override behavior does not respect superclass contract.
incorrect_method_overriding_logic.fix_example: Follow Liskov Substitution Principle and base class expectations.

forgetting_break_in_switch.title: Forgetting Break in Switch
forgetting_break_in_switch.explanation: Missing break causes unintended fall-through between cases.
forgetting_break_in_switch.fix_example: Add break statements or intentional fall-through comments.

modifying_collection_while_iterating.title: Modifying Collection While Iterating
modifying_collection_while_iterating.explanation: Changing collection during iteration can cause runtime errors.
modifying_collection_while_iterating.fix_example: Use Iterator.remove() or collect changes and apply after iteration.

using_mutable_objects_as_map_keys.title: Using Mutable Objects as Map Keys
using_mutable_objects_as_map_keys.explanation: Mutating a key used in maps can break lookups.
using_mutable_objects_as_map_keys.fix_example: Use immutable keys or avoid mutating key fields.

incorrect_equals_hashcode.title: Incorrect equals–hashCode Implementation
incorrect_equals_hashcode.explanation: Inconsistent equals and hashCode cause map or set behavior issues.
incorrect_equals_hashcode.fix_example: Ensure both methods follow the contract and use same fields.

ignoring_thread_safety.title: Ignoring Thread Safety
ignoring_thread_safety.explanation: Concurrent access to shared state without synchronization.
ignoring_thread_safety.fix_example: Use synchronization, locks, or concurrent data structures.

race_condition.title: Race Condition
race_condition.explanation: Program behavior depends on unpredictable thread scheduling.
race_condition.fix_example: Protect shared state with synchronization or lock-free algorithms.

deadlock_risk.title: Deadlock Risk
deadlock_risk.explanation: Multiple locks obtained in inconsistent order can deadlock.
deadlock_risk.fix_example: Always acquire locks in the same global order.

improper_synchronization.title: Improper Synchronization
improper_synchronization.explanation: Incorrect use of synchronized or locks leads to concurrency bugs.
improper_synchronization.fix_example: Synchronize on the correct objects and minimize lock scope.

blocking_in_main_thread.title: Blocking in Main/UI Thread
blocking_in_main_thread.explanation: Long-running tasks block the main or UI thread.
blocking_in_main_thread.fix_example: Run heavy tasks in background threads.

misusing_concurrency_utilities.title: Misusing Concurrency Utilities
misusing_concurrency_utilities.explanation: Incorrect use of executors, futures, or semaphores.
misusing_concurrency_utilities.fix_example: Follow java.util.concurrent best practices and examples.

assuming_execution_order_in_threads.title: Assuming Execution Order in Threads
assuming_execution_order_in_threads.explanation: Thread scheduling assumptions lead to fragile code.
assuming_execution_order_in_threads.fix_example: Use proper coordination mechanisms like join(), locks, or conditions.

not_validating_user_input.title: Not Validating User Input
not_validating_user_input.explanation: Lack of validation can cause crashes or vulnerabilities.
not_validating_user_input.fix_example: Validate all external inputs for type, range, and format.

trusting_external_data_blindly.title: Trusting External Data Blindly
trusting_external_data_blindly.explanation: External data sources are used directly without checks.
trusting_external_data_blindly.fix_example: Sanitize and validate data from files, networks, or users.

incorrect_file_path_handling.title: Incorrect File Path Handling
incorrect_file_path_handling.explanation: Hard-coded or platform-specific paths break portability.

platform_dependent_assumptions.title: Platform-Dependent Assumptions
platform_dependent_assumptions.explanation: Assuming OS-specific behavior (e.g., line endings, file separators).

ignoring_edge_cases.title: Ignoring Edge Cases
ignoring_edge_cases.explanation: Code fails for boundary conditions or special inputs.
ignoring_edge_cases.fix_example: Test with empty, null, min/max values, and unusual cases.

lack_of_input_boundary_checks.title: Lack of Input Boundary Checks
lack_of_input_boundary_checks.explanation: Inputs are not checked for valid ranges.

poor_error_messages.title: Poor Error Messages
poor_error_messages.explanation: Unclear or missing error messages hinder debugging.
poor_error_messages.fix_example: Provide descriptive messages with context and possible causes.

logging_sensitive_data.title: Logging Sensitive Data
logging_sensitive_data.explanation: Sensitive information is printed in logs.
logging_sensitive_data.fix_example: Avoid logging passwords, tokens, or personal data.

ignoring_performance_bottlenecks.title: Ignoring Performance Bottlenecks
ignoring_performance_bottlenecks.fix_example: Profile the application and optimize hot paths.

not_writing_unit_tests.title: Not Writing Unit Tests
not_writing_unit_tests.explanation: Lack of tests reduces confidence in changes.
not_writing_unit_tests.fix_example: Add unit tests for important methods and behavior.

overfitting_logic_to_sample_data.title: Overfitting Logic to Sample Data
overfitting_logic_to_sample_data.explanation: Code only works for a small set of example inputs.
overfitting_logic_to_sample_data.fix_example: Generalize logic and test with varied data.

follow_naming_conventions.title: Follow Consistent Naming Conventions
follow_naming_conventions.explanation: Consistent naming makes code easier to read and maintain.
follow_naming_conventions.fix_example: Use camelCase for variables/methods, PascalCase for classes, UPPER_CASE for constants.

write_clean_readable_code.title: Write Clean and Readable Code
write_clean_readable_code.explanation: Readable code reduces bugs and improves team productivity.
write_clean_readable_code.fix_example: Use proper indentation, whitespace, and meaningful names.

keep_methods_small.title: Keep Methods Small and Focused
keep_methods_small.explanation: Small methods are easier to understand and test.
keep_methods_small.fix_example: Extract complex logic into helper methods.

single_responsibility_principle.title: Follow Single Responsibility Principle
single_responsibility_principle.explanation: Each class or method should have one responsibility.
single_responsibility_principle.fix_example: Split classes/methods that handle multiple concerns.

avoid_code_duplication.title: Avoid Code Duplication (DRY)
avoid_code_duplication.explanation: Duplicate code is harder to maintain.
avoid_code_duplication.fix_example: Extract common logic into reusable functions.

prefer_composition_over_inheritance.title: Prefer Composition Over Inheritance
prefer_composition_over_inheritance.explanation: Composition is more flexible and less tightly coupled than deep inheritance.
prefer_composition_over_inheritance.fix_example: Use fields that reference other objects instead of extending them unnecessarily.

program_to_interfaces.title: Program to Interfaces, Not Implementations
program_to_interfaces.explanation: Depending on interfaces makes code more flexible.
program_to_interfaces.fix_example: Use List instead of ArrayList in method parameters.

use_access_modifiers_properly.title: Use Access Modifiers Properly
use_access_modifiers_properly.explanation: Proper encapsulation improves safety and flexibility.
use_access_modifiers_properly.fix_example: Hide internals with private and expose only necessary APIs as public/protected.

minimize_mutable_state.title: Minimize Mutable State
minimize_mutable_state.explanation: Less mutability reduces bugs and makes reasoning about code easier.
minimize_mutable_state.fix_example: Use final fields and immutable objects when possible.

use_constants_instead_of_magic_numbers.title: Use Constants Instead of Magic Numbers
use_constants_instead_of_magic_numbers.fix_example: Define static final int MAX_RETRIES = 3; and use it.

handle_exceptions_properly.title: Handle Exceptions Properly
handle_exceptions_properly.fix_example: Catch only what you can handle and log or propagate others.

use_try_with_resources.title: Use try-with-resources
use_try_with_resources.explanation: Auto-closing resources reduces leaks and boilerplate.
use_try_with_resources.fix_example: Use try(Resource r = ...) { ... } for AutoCloseable resources.

validate_external_inputs.title: Validate All External Inputs
validate_external_inputs.explanation: Input validation prevents bugs and security issues.
validate_external_inputs.fix_example: Check input size, range, format, and syntax before processing.

write_unit_tests.title: Write Unit Tests
write_unit_tests.explanation: Tests give confidence when refactoring and deploying.
write_unit_tests.fix_example: Use JUnit to test methods with various inputs and edge cases.

test_edge_cases.title: Test Edge Cases Explicitly
test_edge_cases.explanation: Boundary conditions can reveal hidden bugs.
test_edge_cases.fix_example: Include tests for empty collections, nulls, minima, and maxima.

use_version_control.title: Use Version Control Effectively
use_version_control.explanation: Version control helps track changes and collaborate.
use_version_control.fix_example: Commit frequently with meaningful messages using Git.

write_self_documenting_code.title: Write Self-Documenting Code
write_self_documenting_code.explanation: Clear code reduces the need for comments.
write_self_documenting_code.fix_example: Use clear names and simple logic so code explains itself.

follow_code_formatting.title: Follow Standard Code Formatting
follow_code_formatting.fix_example: Use an auto-formatter or follow a style guide (like Google Java Style).

use_logging_instead_of_print.title: Use Logging Instead of print Statements
use_logging_instead_of_print.explanation: Logging is configurable and suitable for production.
use_logging_instead_of_print.fix_example: Use a logging framework with levels (INFO, DEBUG, ERROR).

avoid_premature_optimization.title: Avoid Premature Optimization
avoid_premature_optimization.explanation: Optimizing too early complicates code without clear benefits.
avoid_premature_optimization.fix_example: Focus on clarity first, then optimize after measuring performance.

choose_appropriate_data_structures.title: Choose Appropriate Data Structures
choose_appropriate_data_structures.explanation: Choosing the right structure improves performance and clarity.
choose_appropriate_data_structures.fix_example: Use List for ordered collections, Map for key–value pairs, Set for uniqueness.

use_immutable_objects.title: Use Immutable Objects When Possible
use_immutable_objects.explanation: Immutability helps thread safety and predictability.
use_immutable_objects.fix_example: Avoid setters and use final fields for value types.

avoid_deep_nesting.title: Avoid Deep Nesting
avoid_deep_nesting.explanation: Deeply nested code is hard to read and maintain.
avoid_deep_nesting.fix_example: Use early returns and helper methods to flatten control flow.

prefer_early_returns.title: Prefer Early Returns
prefer_early_returns.explanation: Early returns reduce nested ifs and improve clarity.
prefer_early_returns.fix_example: Return early when conditions are not met instead of adding nested blocks.

encapsulate_object_state.title: Encapsulate Object State
encapsulate_object_state.explanation: Proper encapsulation protects invariants and internal logic.
encapsulate_object_state.fix_example: Make fields private and provide controlled accessors.

make_dependencies_explicit.title: Make Dependencies Explicit
make_dependencies_explicit.explanation: Hidden dependencies make code harder to understand and test.
make_dependencies_explicit.fix_example: Inject dependencies via constructors or setters.

use_dependency_injection.title: Use Dependency Injection
use_dependency_injection.explanation: DI frameworks simplify management of object dependencies.
use_dependency_injection.fix_example: Use constructor injection or DI containers like Spring where appropriate.

avoid_static_abuse.title: Avoid Static Abuse
avoid_static_abuse.explanation: Overusing static methods and fields reduces flexibility.
avoid_static_abuse.fix_example: Prefer instance-based design and proper object lifecycles.

design_for_testability.title: Design for Testability
design_for_testability.explanation: Testable design makes it easier to maintain quality.
design_for_testability.fix_example: Separate logic from I/O and use interfaces to mock dependencies.

write_modular_code.title: Write Modular Code
write_modular_code.explanation: Modularity enables reuse and easier understanding.
write_modular_code.fix_example: Divide the system into cohesive modules or packages.

follow_layered_architecture.title: Follow Layered Architecture
follow_layered_architecture.explanation: Separating layers (UI, business, data) improves structure.
follow_layered_architecture.fix_example: Keep controllers, services, and repositories separate.

separate_business_logic_from_ui.title: Separate Business Logic from UI
separate_business_logic_from_ui.explanation: Mixing UI and logic makes code hard to modify.
separate_business_logic_from_ui.fix_example: Put business rules into service classes or domain models.

handle_concurrency_explicitly.title: Handle Concurrency Explicitly
handle_concurrency_explicitly.explanation: Explicit concurrency handling avoids subtle race conditions.
handle_concurrency_explicitly.fix_example: Use synchronization, locks, or java.util.concurrent tools intentionally.

use_thread_safe_constructs.title: Use Thread-Safe Constructs
use_thread_safe_constructs.explanation: Thread-safe constructs help avoid concurrency bugs.
use_thread_safe_constructs.fix_example: Use ConcurrentHashMap, AtomicInteger, and thread-safe patterns where needed.

document_public_apis.title: Document Public APIs
document_public_apis.explanation: API documentation helps users understand contracts and usage.
document_public_apis.fix_example: Use JavaDoc to describe parameters, return values, and behavior.

keep_methods_side_effect_minimal.title: Keep Methods Side-Effect Minimal
keep_methods_side_effect_minimal.explanation: Functions with fewer side-effects are easier to reason about.
keep_methods_side_effect_minimal.fix_example: Limit state changes and avoid hidden mutations.

clean_up_unused_code.title: Clean Up Unused Code
clean_up_unused_code.explanation: Dead code increases noise and confusion.
clean_up_unused_code.fix_example: Delete unused methods, fields, and classes.

review_code_regularly.title: Review Code Regularly
review_code_regularly.explanation: Code reviews catch issues early and share knowledge.
review_code_regularly.fix_example: Use peer reviews or pull requests as part of the workflow.

refactor_continuously.title: Refactor Continuously
refactor_continuously.explanation: Continuous refactoring keeps the codebase healthy.
refactor_continuously.fix_example: Regularly improve design without changing behavior.
